frame.name: Timespan
frame.definition:
<def-root>The words in this frame describe a period of time, as opposed to a point in time.
<ex>The <fex name="Descriptor">best</fex> <t>time</t> <fex name="Whole">of year</fex> <fex name="State">for planting</fex> tends to be fairly regular.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>State</fen>'s duration. In this frame, the duration can be inexact.</def-root>

FE.name: State
FE.definition:
<def-root>An ongoing state whose duration can be measured.
<ex><fex name="State">He was a great actor</fex> <m>in</m> his <t>time</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Whole
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Whole</fen> is the larger moment in time of which the target is a part.
<ex>What <t>time</t> <fex name="Whole">of year</fex> do you suggest we visit Tbilisi?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>Any characterization or evaluation of the timespan not covered by a more specific FE.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: day.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a period of time in an entity's past

lexUnit.name: time.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an indefinite period of time
